columns.text: In this problem, we need to find the float and weighted average delay.

**a)**  In this part we need to find the total float for the month. The neighbor  picks up two check, one for $\$10,700$ which takes four days to clear after it is deposited, and second check for $\$4,600$ takes three days to clear after it is deposited. So, total float for the month is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total float}&=\$10,700\cdot 4+\$4,600\cdot3\\
&=\$42,800+\$13,800\\
&=\$56,600
\end{align*}$$

**b)**  To find the average daily float, we will divide total float for the month by total days in month. So,
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Average daily float}&=\frac{\text{Total float}}{\text{Total days}}\\
&=\frac{\$56,600}{30}\\
&=\$1,886.67\\
&\approx \$1,887
\end{align*}$$

**c)**  In thsi part, we need to find the average daily receipts and weighted average delay. 

Total monthly receipts  of our neighbor is 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Total receipts}&=\$10,700+\$4,600=\$15,300
\end{align*}$$
Average daily receipts are
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Average daily receipts}&=\frac{\text{Total receipts}}{\text{Total days}}\\
&=\frac{\$15,300}{30}\\
&=\$510
\end{align*}$$
Weighted average delay will be calculated as follows 

$$\begin{align*}
\text{Weighted average delay}&=\frac{\$10,700}{\$15,300}\cdot 4\hspace{2mm}\text{days}+\frac{\$4,600}{\$15,300}\cdot 3\hspace{2mm}\text{days}\\
&=2.8\hspace{2mm}\text{days}+0.9\hspace{2mm}\text{days}\\
&=3.7\hspace{2mm}\text{days}
\end{align*}$$
